Issues.Title: Clickonce couldn't publish a rdlc report
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

 .net 6.0     VS 2022 17.6.4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

when i use clickonce publish a rdlc report  in a c# winform project at visual studio 2022 environment,get below message:Unable to apply publication properties for item 'report\*.rdlc',

### Steps to reproduce

...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clickonce couldn't publish a rdlc report" (#9368)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in DesignerActionService and DesignerActionUIService
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `DesignerActionService`, `DesignerActionUIService`, and all the internal code these classes use: `DesignerActionUI` and `SelectionManager`


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9367)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable nullability in DesignerActionService and DesignerActionUIService" (#9367)

Issues.Title: Add SplitContainer to the integration test in DemoConsle
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9329


## Proposed changes

- Add SplitContainer to the Integration test inDemoConsle

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- SplitContainer can be tested in the Integration test project.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/324bc553-7db3-4fc6-8cff-f2b85f90e88f)

### After

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/68473035-a028-45eb-8a68-4f20459fca0f)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

-  Manually (added SplitContainer to DemoConsole test app)

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 8.0.100-preview.7.23324.2
- Windows 10.0.22621


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: Cannot get the DateTimePicker's Text value
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-preview.7.23323.19

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in previous .Net SDK version: 7.0/6.0/5.0

### Issue description

Cannot get the DateTimePicker's Text value. 

**.Net 8.0 Preview 7:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/6485eb69-dcda-44cc-a026-219aabe8626c)

**.Net 7.0:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/a135420a-99eb-416f-8ab4-c53913d56d8a)


### Steps to reproduce

Sample app:
[WinFormsApp30.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11859131/WinFormsApp30.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot get the DateTimePicker's Text value" (#9363)

Issues.Title: Fix GH issue:9271 by updating Accessibility app
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9271 by updating Accessibility app: set printPreviewControl1.TabStop = true and printPreviewControl's AccessibleName property with "Image layout ready for printing"

Issues.Title: Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2208919
Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/icxLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9359)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/8.0-preview6] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#9359)

Issues.Title: Dynamically query interfaces in AxHost
Issues.Body:
Get native interfaces by querying when needed. This is more performant than creating a RCW for these interfaces and is a step towards enabling AOT.

This does not change the serialization interfaces, they will come in a follow-up PR. The handling there is a little trickier.

Also:

- Some style cleanup
- Add a interface check helper in ComScope
- Add a simple assert helper in HRESULT
- Fix ref count in COM2PictureConverter test

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9358)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Dynamically query interfaces in AxHost" (#9358)

Issues.Title: Defer StackTrace rendering
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9304

Marked as draft because this is a real bug that needs to be investigated. If someone has the ability to update CI to collect a heap dump when one of these crashes occurs, it would be significantly preferred to just hiding it with a workaround like this.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9357)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Defer StackTrace rendering" (#9357)

Issues.Title: Include stack trace from log method
Issues.Body:
Sometimes the first chance exception stack is incomplete, so the additional stack collected at the point where it's written to the log can help narrow down code locations.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9356)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Include stack trace from log method" (#9356)

Issues.Title: Remove unused code
Issues.Body:
These declarations was added in 35b0c525bdf8b7a72c61cc0b970e090d749adffc and usage removed in 90242d4409f2fb5533f5291631d49fb8cc026a35.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9355)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove unused code" (#9355)

Issues.Title: Use `KEYEVENTF_EXTENDEDKEY` flag only extended keys
Issues.Body:
Use `KEYEVENTF_EXTENDEDKEY` flag only when calling [SendInput](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-sendinput) function with [scan codes](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/win32/inputdev/about-keyboard-input#scan-codes) that have 0xE0 prefix.

See:
https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-keybdinput https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/win32/inputdev/about-keyboard-input#extended-key-flag


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9354)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use `KEYEVENTF_EXTENDEDKEY` flag only extended keys" (#9354)

Issues.Title: Add Click Through behavior to `ToolStrip`/`MenuStrip`
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9288
Fixes #9240
Fixes #9277

Unsure on the attributes for the new property and whether or not an auto implemented property is okay.

I went with 'AllowClickThrough' because I thought it was more self documenting.

My development environment isn't fully setup yet so this was a very quick pr without any testing.

Issues.Title: Move IMso code to new interop pattern
Issues.Body:
This moves IMso* types to follow our new pattern for interop.

I've also changed UIntPtr types to nuint and added <para> elements for the comments where needed. Also added a few doc links.

Also reduce some nesting in ThreadContext and use typed WeakReference in ComponentManager.

Issues.Body:
Fixed solution links
Added link to the blog post about custom designers for OOP designer

Issues.Title: Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2207309
Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/icxLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

Issues.Title: Add GroupBox.BorderStyle Property
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

It would be very useful to add GroupBox.BorderStyle property that allows to show or hide GroupBox border. There are a lot of discussions on Stackoverflow how to deal with GroupBox border, see the [link](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15070040/system-windows-forms-groupbox-hide-frame). But currently there is no property to change border appearance.
When a UserControl is developed, a control consumer often needs an option whether to display a control with a border or not, depending on the location (screenshot below).
![group_box](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/9930867/273269e1-5d4b-452c-89f2-7f00552a0511)


### API Proposal

```csharp
groupBox.BorderStyle = BorderStyle.None;
```


### API Usage

```csharp
groupBox.BorderStyle = BorderStyle.None;
```


### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

_No response_

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

VS Designer supports the BorderStyle property as usual.
This feature does not need to be localized.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add GroupBox.BorderStyle Property" (#9343)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in DesignerHost and SiteNestedContainer
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `DesignerHost` and `SiteNestedContainer` 
- Change `Hashtable` with `Dictionary<object, object>` in `DesignerHost` (contributes to #8143)
- Stop throwing null-reference exceptions when adding or removing null components from `DesignHost` and `SiteNestedContainer`. The idea behind this change (that is obviously open for debate) is that it makes those method match the behaviour of the ones they override (from class `Container`). This one is the second commit, that can easily be rollbacked.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9340)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable nullability in DesignerHost and SiteNestedContainer" (#9340)
